sense.name: advance or cause to advance slowly
sense.examples: He edged towards the car. Giles edged the car forward and drawing closer we could see them. At two in the afternoon I nervously edged in to Theory of Computation. Slowly the moshing pit formed as they edged in to listen. One hedgehog edged up to the hedge as the other hedgehog edged down. The unemployment rate edged up to 5.8 percent in December.

sense.name: provide with a border
sense.examples: The seamstress edged the quilt with embroidery. The afternoon lighting and warm essence of autumn edged the lace curtains in gold. I edged all the pages in silver.

sense.name: share a boundary with
sense.examples: The new cultural center consists of conversions of silos that edged the city for years. Steady snow in the morning covered the brown patches of grass that edged the tracks.

sense.name: trim or cut
sense.examples: Then I edged the lawn along the sidewalk and driveway. I edged the outside of the planting beds to reshape and redefine them.

sense.name: sharpen
sense.examples: She quickly edged the blade on the rock and tried not to think what would happen if she were caught. He cleaned the hoses, edged the shears, and trimmed the bushes.

sense.name: beat, surpass
sense.examples: The Adams-Friendship Green Devils basketball team edged the visiting Onalaska Hilltoppers. In team score the West edged out the Midwest by a mere margin of 15 points. Gregory came in as the seventh seed, but edged out the competition by six inches.
